definition: opening speech (at a conference)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Did you come early enough for the chairman's opening speech?
sentences.chinese: 你是早在主席致開幕詞前就來了的嗎？

sentences.english: Comrade Yang delivered the opening speech.
Chen Wenhao, Mayor of Changde City delivered the opening speech.
sentences.chinese: 常德市市長陳文浩致開幕詞。

sentences.english: He is invited to give an opening speech.
Mr. Smith delivered the opening speech.
Speech by Mr. Paul Tang, J. P. , Director of Social Welfare.
sentences.chinese: 社會福利署署長鄧國威太平紳士致開幕詞。

sentences.english: She has accepted to give the opening speech at our conference.
sentences.chinese: 她已同意在我們的大會上致開幕詞。

sentences.english: He was asked to give an opening speech at the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 有人請他在會上致開幕詞。
